intro: Astragalus sciureus var. tefreschensis, commonly known as the Tefreschensis milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its root system is notable for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
